original_title: Sri Lanka destroys seized cigarettes which could have cost Rs13bn in taxes
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has destroyed seized smuggled cigarettes which would have resulted in a loss of 13 billion rupees in taxes if they displaced legal products in the market, State Minister for Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitya said.
A stock of 204 million cigarettes, valued at 15 billion rupees, was destroyed at a storage yard in Kerawalapitiya on June 15.
The stock was imported in 2021, and penalties were charged against three people who were later arrested.
“These cigarettes arrived from Dubai in violation of the Tobacco Act and Customs regulations,” said Sanjaya Ravindra, a senior deputy director at Sri Lanka Customs, speaking to EconomyNetx.
“Three people were arrested, and penalties were charged against them and the shipping lines.”
Customs regulations in Sri Lanka do not allow any tobacco products to be brought into the country. (Colombo/ June15/2023)
